title: Single Select
contents:
Single Selectlink

Multiselect can be also used as single select, simply by specifying multiselect property to be false. By default it is set to true. Also you can hook up on different events from the multiselect dropdown

For single select the helper elements such as ‘Select All’, ‘Select None’ buttons will not be shown because it is not required in case of single select. ’Reset’ will work as expected in case of single select also.

Demolink

<p>Which country do you prefer to live for your lifetime?..</p> <ngx-multiselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCountry" [options]="countries" ngDefaultControl> </ngx-multiselect> import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'ms-single-select', templateUrl: './single-select.component.html', }) export class SingleSelectComponent implements OnInit { countries; selectedCountry; constructor() { } ngOnInit() { this.countries = [{ id: 1, name: "India"}, { id: 2, name: "USA" }, { id: 3, name: "China" }, { id: 4, name: "Japan" }, { id: 5, name: "Australia" }, { id: 6, name: "Brazil" } ]; this.selectedCountry = { id: 1, name: "India" }; } }
